description: A dramatization in black and white of a series of mostly grisly events that took place in Wisconsin between 1890 and 1900 as reported in the Black River Falls newspaper.
keywords: mother drowning her child,watching tv,abandoned by husband,winnebago indian,filicide
name: Wisconsin Death Trip

review.name: The not so good old days in Wisconsin .................
review.reviewBody: "Wisconsin Death Trip" Is a compilation of newspaper accounts from the Black River Falls area in the 1890s. The film delivers the facts along with glorious black and white photographs. Apparrently at the time, life had little value, and depression ran rampant. A nice assortment of calamities are covered including, irrational behavior (window smashing), suicides, dementia, a Diptheria epidemic, superstitions, murder, witchcraft, spirits, and lots of other depressing matters. Many perpetrators of these calamitous acts are dealt with by simply locking them away in the local insane asylum. The movie is loosely structured around crimes committed during the the four seasons. Though somewhat redundant, "Wisconsin death Trip" is also frequently fascinating. - MERK
